abstract: Amazon has agreed to give NBC Universal something that Apple would not: greater flexibility in the pricing and packaging of video downloads.
snippet: Amazon has agreed to give NBC Universal something that Apple would not: greater flexibility in the pricing and packaging of video downloads.
lead_paragraph: NBC Universal significantly deepened its relationship with Amazon’s digital video download service after a dispute with Apple over the pricing of television shows on iTunes.

headline.main: NBC in Deal With Amazon to Sell Shows on the Web
headline.print_headline: NBC in Deal With Amazon To Sell Shows On the Web

abstract: Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive, called the moves a “total refresh” of the iPod.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive, called the moves a “total refresh” of the iPod.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5 — Apple announced a price cut for its iPhone today, along with a new iPod that looks like the iPhone and a version of its iTunes store that downloads music directly to the player rather than a computer.

headline.main: Apple Cuts iPhone Price and Revamps iPods

byline.original: By Damon Darlin and John Markoff

abstract: Of all the features that Apple may add to its iPod line, wireless music capability may be the most important.
snippet: Of all the features that Apple may add to its iPod line, wireless music capability may be the most important.
lead_paragraph: Apple, it seems, has a press conference today. Everyone seems to think that the company will update its iPod line. There are a bevy of rumors about various possible improvements. Let me suggest that the most important one to watch for is iPods with Wi-Fi.

headline.main: Watching Apple Today? Look for the Wi-Fi

abstract: Steve Jobs first announcment: iPhone ringtones.
snippet: Steve Jobs first announcment: iPhone ringtones.
lead_paragraph: I’m inside the Moscone Center. We won’t live blog every jot and tittle. But I’ll post as there are significant announcements (or at least significant to the Apple-obsessed ).

headline.main: Apple Event: Do-It-Yourself Ringtones for $1.98 Each

abstract: Good news for those who want a purple iPod or to watch video on a tiny tiny screen.
snippet: Good news for those who want a purple iPod or to watch video on a tiny tiny screen.
lead_paragraph: Steve Jobs is now talking about the iPod. A total refresh of the iPod line he says.

headline.main: Apple Event: New Colors for the Shuffle; Video for the Nano

abstract: The new iPod Touch has Wi-Fi access, a web browser and a touch screen. For $299 and up. Meanwhile, Apple cut $200 from the price of the iPhone.
snippet: The new iPod Touch has Wi-Fi access, a web browser and a touch screen. For $299 and up. Meanwhile, Apple cut $200 from the price of the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: The big news of the day is the iPod Touch. It’s an iPod that looks like an iPhone. It has a 3.5-inch screen, the Multitouch interface, Wi-Fi and the Safari Web browser.

headline.main: Apple Event: A Touch-Screen Wi-Fi iPod

abstract: The iPhone Touch may represent the future of media use: audio and video that can be played both from local storage and from a vast server with everything.
snippet: The iPhone Touch may represent the future of media use: audio and video that can be played both from local storage and from a vast server with everything.
lead_paragraph: Reactions to Apple’s various product announcements are pouring in. I’ll start with mine. As I wrote this morning, the most significant aspect of all this is the emergence of a class of portable computer that can surf the Web, listen to music and watch video, all from a server. The price is now $299. It will doubtless be half that in a few years. And all the limits that people are complaining about — storage, etc. — will be long gone.

headline.main: Apple Reactions: The Future of Wireless Audio and Video

abstract: The Nano is both fat and thin. People who bought the iPhone at $599 are mad that the price is now $399. And more reactions.
snippet: The Nano is both fat and thin. People who bought the iPhone at $599 are mad that the price is now $399. And more reactions.
lead_paragraph: The gadget bloggers have had a few minutes to play with the new iPods, and here is some of their reaction.
